titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Views of Brooklyn viewbooks ARC.228
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2026-01-23 14:51:44 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Two viewbooks containing black and white images documenting the built environment in Brooklyn, circa 1905. The viewbooks were published by L.H. Nelson Company of Portland, ME in 1905 and 1910.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1986.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: L.H. Nelson Company was a publisher based in Portland, ME that published viewbooks and photographs of prominent cities and summer resorts. Viewbooks, also called souvenir albums or view albums, are books that contain commercially published groups of photographs depicting a place, activity, or event.

list.head: Sources:
list.item: Getty Research Institute: Art & Architecture Thesaurus. "Viewbooks." Accessed June 27, 2011. http://www.getty.edu/vow/AATFullDisplay?find=viewbooks&logic=AND&note=&english=N&prev_page=1&subjectid=300026684

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Views of Brooklyn viewbooks, V1986.015, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection combines the accessions V1986.015 and V1986.016.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: CBH also holds many other viewbooks with images of Brooklyn, Long Island and New York City. Please consult CBH staff for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Views of Brooklyn viewbooks contain black-and-white non-photographic prints of photographs documenting the built environment in Brooklyn, circa 1905. The viewbooks were published by L.H. Nelson Company of Portland, ME in 1905 and 1910. The original softcovers have been recovered with hardcover library bindings. The hardcovers have become brittle and many of the pages have separated from the bindings. The page size for both viewbooks is 8 x 10. Subjects include church buildings, school buildings, monuments, clubhouses, and bank buildings, among other building types. Views of Prospect Park, Coney Island, and Brooklyn Heights are also well-represented. One viewbook contains 71 images, while the other viewbook contains only 46 images.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The images in this collection are in the public domain.
